comment_text:
There's a YouTube channel by an astrophysicist who keeps an eye on solar activity. He's postulated a theory and written a paper on the possibility of a Carrington Event combined with a micro-nova. It seems that there is a relationship between the build up of geomagnetic forces when stars move through the Galactic plane. This results in an accretion of matter on the surface of a star. This matter then gets ejected in one gigantic explosion, similar to a supernova at the end of a star's life, except it happens on a regular basis, every 12,000 years or so.

The effect of such an explosion would be catastrophic to Earth. It would cause the planet to flip the poles to new positions for a period and then return to their original position at the next cycle. The sudden change of the poles would not only cause tectonic activity, but massive tsunamis which would flood across entire continents. His paper suggests that there is evidence of these cyclical disasters all over the planet and it may even be the source of the story of Noah's Flood in the Bible.

He suggests that this event may not be far off as it appears that stars near to Earth have recently experienced luminosity changes corresponding with a micro-nova and then returned to their normal luminosity afterwards. This might not cause the end of human civilization, but it could send mankind back to the iron ages.

TRANSCRIPT (idk why I’m doing this lol):

the sun is so hot that it rips atoms into electrons and nuclei all flowing around eachother in plasma
This plasma is pushed around by the suns magnetic field (similar to how the suns gravitational field reaches out to the planets, shaping their orbit
But magnetism is very different from gravity
Magnetism is a part of a dual force called electromagnetism
Electricity creates magnetic fields, which create energy
On the sun, the plasma, made up of electrically charged protons and electrons, creates a magnetic field as they move
This magnetic field shapes the flow of particles
These particles are stuck in a dynamic feedback loop called a dyanmo (dynamos keep the suns magnetic field alive)
This magnetic field stores enourmous amounts of energy, and leaks out over the solar system
With it, it carries a constant trickle of solar plasma like a light rain, known as the solar wind, creating a sort of space weather
This wind isn’t always calm and smooth.
As the suns plasma churns and flows around itself, it’s magnetic field gets all kinked and twisted
This creates magnetic knots that store up intense amounts of energy
When the magnetic knots break apart , like a tangle of springs exploding outwards the sun can vomit plasma and all other sorts of unpleasant thing s into the solar system
These solar storms come in many different forms

a tidal wave of high energy radiation
They race through the solar system at the speed of light, sweeping up protons in the solar wind, accelerating them into a high speed solar proton storm

rip millions or billions of tons of plasma from the suns atmosphere, catapulting it through the solar system at speeds of up to 9 million kph
When these monsters hit us, nothing happens on earth

smaller storms damage satellites, affect radio communication, or be dangerous to astronauts, for people on the surface, such space weather si harmless
Earths atmosphere protects us from the worst effects of a sola flare by absorbing the blasts of x rays high up in the atmosphere,well before it reaches the surface. However, with global warming more constant these days’ our atmosphere is detoriating, making us more vulnerable to these storms
Earths atmosphere absorbs the blast of x rays high up in the atmosphere
The electrified plasma from a CME is deflected by the earths magnetic field, diverting the energy storm to the north and south poles, where energetic particles fall into the atmosphere, causing the atmosphere to glow and create auroras
Sometimes, there are solar super storms

happen every once or twice in a century
If one were to happen today, we would detect strong solar flares, a sort of flash before the much more dangerous thunder
The thunder is a CME, consisting of billions of tons of hot magnetic plasma, that crosses the 150 million kilometres between the sun and earth in less than a day
When it arrives, it causes a shockwave that violently compresses the earth s magnetic field and transfers energy into the magnetosphere
It can get worse” if the magnetic field of the CME Is aligned to earths in the. Right way, the the two magnetic fields would combined
As the magnetic cloud passes over earth, it turns earth field into a tail
Eventually, the energy stored in this tail becomes too much to contain. It will snap and release its energy towards earth
This creates a geomagnetic storm

a few hundred years ago, nobody would have cared. The storm is not effective to machines made of meat and bones (humans), but it is effective to metal and wire
Why? Magenetism creates electric currents.
Earth, in the 21st century is covered in millions of wires, transporting electricity and complex grids of machines that make these transfers possible .
A CMEs energy can induce currents in our power that would either completely cause it to shut down, or worse, destroy the transformer stations that keep our grids running
This has happened already in quebec in 1989
The last time a solar storm rushed over earth was in 1859, the carrington event

largest geomagnetic storm ever recorded on earth
Massive auroras appeared in the Caribbean
It was so bright, people got up thinking the sun had been risingn
Luckily, we only had one source of modern tech back then, telegraphs
During the carrington event, these telegraphs failed all over the world and socked their operators, chucking out sparks
Today since we have more technology, there would be a larger effect of a solar flare on us,
Solar flares are bound to happen soon,
A solar storm as strong as the carrington event nearly missed our earth in 2012
Studies projected that it would have inflicted serious damage in electronic systems globally, costing up to 2.6 trillion dollars to the us alone
Replacing the damaged systems was estimated to take around 4- 10 years
Per decade, the estimated chance for a solar flare is about 12 percent
That’s about a 50/50 chance of one happening in the next 50 years

studies predicted that even calm stars like our sun can create super flares every thousand years
Eruptions orders of magnitude would be stronger than the strongest flares ever observed in our solar systems
If such a storm hits us unprepared, the effects would be catastrophic
It’s hard to overstate how much we rely on technology. From lights, to communication, computers to navigations. A sustained power outage would lead to a breakdown of our supply chain. Water supply depleting, and hospital generators running dry, super markets not being refilled, while food rots in the field.
Rebooting this power would take years, or even decades, destroying our civilisation
Fortunately, even though solar storms aren’t preventable, virtually all of their nasty side effects are Scientists observing the sun would have a few days to see that a CME is coming And engineers working with the power systems are well aware of the effects of. CMEs Transformers and substations can be taken offline Engineers can open up different lines to dispute the power, And we could prevent the world from being affected by solar flares.

(Oh God, Jesus Christ, etc.) If you have done this, you have violated God’s moral law, you admit that you are a liar, a thief, a blasphemer, and an adulterer at heart. So, if God gave you justice right away, would you be innocent or guilty? Obviously guilty. Heaven or hell? Obviously hell because you are a criminal in God's eyes. Don’t ask for forgiveness, try it in court: Judge, I raped a woman and killed her, but I’m so sorry and I won’t do it again. You would still go to jail because you shouldn’t do it again and you should be sorry. So is there any hope? Yes, there is! Out of love and mercy, God became a human being, Jesus Christ. Jesus lived a sinless life and finally died on the cross to bear the punishment we deserve. His resurrection proved that His death( more accurately, His sacrifical Blood) was enough to pay our penalty, the penalty for our sins. When someone pays your fine, the judge can leave you, dismiss your case, it’s the same with God. Jesus paid our penalty and in order to accept the free gift of salvation from God, we must believe (have faith in Jesus for our salvation, His finished work on the Cross). That's it! Okay questions that I feel like I want to ask more specifically
1. What exactly is influenced by those solar storms? Metals? Conductors in general? Magnets? Do they have to be running (have electricity flowing through) to be affected?
2. In exactly what ways does the solar storms (directly) cause damage? Heat? Electric arcs/sparks? Explosions?
3. Does unplugging stuff protect against solar storms? What about battery-powered technology? What about batteries themselves (even when they are not powering anything, say when your phone is turned off)?
4. Except for patients that rely on life-supporting technology, and except long-term effects of having technology shut down, are there other short-term, life-threatening damages from the solar storms? Do they directly cause things on the human body? Do they cause, for example, explosions that indirectly hurt people?

I am not quite sure this comment is going to be read, as I think it will require a lot of likes to get your attention. And to get lot of likes, a comment shouldn't be longer than one line. The reason because this comment is not going to get your attention, is wrote in the comment itself... But anyway, let's find this out.
I think that a video about the smartphone and the damages it is doing to the brains of young people, is the way to go in this moment. I'm not talking about electro-magnetic waves or things like that, I am talking about some real psychological problems that we will see becaming concrete in the next years. Lost of empathy for real persons, lost of desire, unability to recognize facial expressions, lost of focus, and so on. When we talk about our minds, humans have two very important stimuli:
The need of creating social relations, and the need of dispelling boredom. The magic rectangle we have in our pocket is capable of satisfying both these primary needs (do not be surprised if a child can spend his whole day on a social network that can both make him laugh and let him talk with his friends). The only limit that is protecting us from confusing the real world with the virtual world where we are so addicted to live is the technology. More then one bilion of children have acces to this virtual world from the youngest ages (sometimes their parents give them the smartphon at 3-4 years old to let them play, and they end up being completely addicted to the virtual world. They prefer the virtual world, to the real one). You don't see this as a problem because you, like me, are likely to have grown without nothing more than a taste of this virtual world from sci-fi tv-shows or film. Your brain is developed on the real model of the world, you can get inside the virtual world for five hours, shut down your phone and go out for a walk with your friends. But for those who are less aware of what is real or not, the risk is more than concrete. From my point of view, children should be educated to develop their real life skills (like comunication) and THEN develop their virtual life skills. If we don't start to raise awareness, in both the victims and the parents, the damage can be catastrophic. And if you look around yourself, you can see that it's already a huge mess. I got more than opinions and i can validate what i am saying with data and surveys. If you are interested in more than a textwall-comment under a video, I can share a lot of material on this topic and help you for free as best as I can. I don't want any mention, any special thanks, and i don't want to own this idea. The only thing i want, is for peolpe to know.

Falun Gong practitioners in Hualien, Taiwan held activities to raise awareness of the persecution of their faith in China as usual on March 15, 2020. They put up posters and demonstrated the five sets of Falun Gong exercises.

They called for an end to the Chinese Communist Party’s (CCP) persecution of Falun Gong, including the state-sanctioned organ harvesting from living practitioners. They also collected signatures for a petition opposing the persecution.


Demonstrating the Falun Gong exercises


People sign a petition against the persecution.

Mr. Hsia was on vacation in Hualien. While he waited for the train, a practitioner asked him if he’d sign their petition.

“I support Falun Gong practitioners’ activities to expose the persecution,” he said. “Because my work is related to the Internet, I know that the CCP persecutes Falun Gong and that this cruel persecution is illegal and intrusive.”

“Last year, I saw the U.S. State Department’s International Religious Freedom Report, which mentions the CCP’s cruel persecution of various beliefs is a norm, including Falun Gong, Christians, Tibetan Buddhists, Uyghurs, and underground churches.”

“So I know that the persecution is going on. The CCP does not allow the Chinese people to have religious freedom because it is atheist,” Hsia said.

A high school student named Wang said he had read about forced organ harvesting before. “In class, our teacher also had us read about recent developments in mainland China’s lung transplants.”

“The news said there was only a five-day wait for a healthy, well-matched double lung transplant. The hospital had one transplant operation in two or three days. It had completed more than 1,000 lung transplant operations.

“At the time we asked, ‘Where do so many organs come from? Waiting for a match in Taiwan would take many years.’

“The teacher later told us earnestly that facing a persecution of human rights, everyone should speak out, because helping others is also helping oneself,” Wang said.

A car rental employee named Lin said, “I felt an energy from your group exercise site while I was waiting for customers. I felt surrounded by something formless, and it made me warm and comfortable.” He eagerly signed the practitioners’ petition and learned about the Falun Gong exercises.

Your verdict seems much too optimistic. You say scientists monitoring the sun have a day to warn humanity and engineers are aware of the problem. Do they? Are they?
It's not enough that scientists monitor the sun, you also need a proper global warning system set up, that reacts WITHIN A DAY. 24 hours from the observation of some shifter of a sun-monitoring instrument to the engineers of the last municipality on earth flicking the off switch. And keep in mind, it's people who are sitting at both ends of the chain who might make a mistake: the young PhD scientist on boring shift duty of the instrument that has to make the right decision, knowing that the repercussions are globally; and the engineers who have to cause a black-out, which is dangerous in itself.
There is no way we are prepared. Last I heard it wasn't even clear whether we HAVE a sun-monitoring instrument any longer, as an old one is about to reach its end of life. We also cannot put the start of the warning chain in the hands of scientists - science is much too slow. It would need to be a military/government-controlled instrument that has the authority to trigger a warning. And even if modern, mainly western electricity companies are training their engineers to be prepared, do you think that in regions where black-outs happen every so often the engineers are prepared as well to cause one?

Half way through the video:
Guys, it called R.A.S. here in the US. Remedial Action System. It can shut off the grid when events like this and worse ones happen. It would knock the North American gird offline for a few hours to a day. The EU might be similar, but I don't know for sure about their system. The worst that would happen would be some of the fuses at some substations at best.
I say this not just because of the RAS system, but also since we have observatories in both space and here on Earth that would give us plenty of warning to turn off sensitive electronics, shield receivers, and to disconnect the circuits of the power grid, rendering them immune to almost all damage from even the worse event our sun could throw at us.

Even the simplest of organisms has a code that dictates the structure and organization of their entire body. Along with that of their offspring. And the phenomenon known as consciousness that is both connected to and somehow separate from the electronic signals your brain produces. With consciousness, you are aware of your existence and can sense and interact with the world around you in limited but meaningful ways.

Part of what creates turbulence, maximums and minimums in the sun's magnetic field isn't simply the plasma churning inside of it, but the orientation of magnetic bodies around the sun, such as the electromagnetic Charge returning from the gas giants notably Jupiter and Neptune -- and also the Charge beyond the solar system from the galactic core, other stars, and the sun's orientation within the larger field.  As the outer planets magnetic poles and charge vertices align and disalign, and as the sun moves through more dense and less dense regions of charge in the galaxy, the the constant changing charge density determines the sun's charging up and charging down.  Maximums correspond mainly to Jupiter at a certain point of its orbit around the sun, but also other planets which orbit at different speeds can make some maximums weak while others are extremely full of activity.  When a lot of charge is returning TO the sun you get more solar flares, while when the planets are at 90 degree angles and are creating destructive phase alignment with the spin of the magnetic field of the sun you get minimums  like the last one we're just now exiting.    It has less to do with what's going on inside the sun itself, it is much more predictable than current mainstream theory knows.

Carrington Event.
Geomagnetic storm, telegraph lines were smoking, telegraph equipment burst into flames.
If it had happened today, technic civilization would sputter and die.
Power lines would act as massive antennas, funneling vast overloads into the power grid.
Power generation would fail; rebuilding a burnt-out power-plant generator will take months. If ever.
Blackouts of power and communication on a continental scale.
Food production and distribution would be disrupted, economies collapse. Can't ship grain unless someone pays for it...can't pay when banks stop working.
Without electrical power, no water. No ATM's. No money at all if the networks are down. Gas-stations can't pump fuel, so no fueling up and running away from it all.
When the language of Empire becomes the common language of the world, that Empire will soon fall. Philosophers words, not mine.
Electrical power is the 'lingua franca' of our Current society. Yes, that was a pun.
We depend on it utterly, but we have no back-up when it fails. See many oil-lamps and much lamp-oil at Target lately?
I haven't seen any kerosene powered short-wave radios, TV's or ATM's.
What are you gonna do when a geomagnetic storm comes along and burns the insulation off the wiring leading to your house?
Where do you get new wiring? Who is going to install it? How is anyone going to get paid? Barter will make a comeback.
How could everyone get their stuff rebuilt/replaced after another Carrington Event? Means of production are ruined, economy erased....
New Dark Ages; where the ruling class has functional electronics and the peasants are using candles. Rechargeable batteries will be the new money.
The group who could take control a wind-farm would be Kings.
Over time, the remaining pockets of technology dwindle and fail until things like electric lights and telephones become stories told over firelight.
Can't produce new electronics without working electronics and electrical power.
Carrington Event.

I'm leaving this comment because; I like this video, I like this channel, and the YouTube algorithm rewards videos that generate more comments. I am not a bot. I am a real life person. However, I am forced to behave like a bot or I want to best support the Creators whose content I enjoy. So I try to copy and paste these same thoughts each time I like a video. Apparently it's not enough to use the "thumb" system and share videos with others when I think they'll enjoy the content. I find this to be a disturbing move by YouTube because it essentially means that they don't care whether or not I enjoy the video. In fact, they might even prefer I hate videos since that is likely to generate more comments. I feel that this method of rewarding "engagement" is toxic and will likely lead to my being less engaged. I don't want to engage most of time and I pay for a premium subscription. Lastly, how are your earning more ad revenue from people who are typing out comments all the time instead of watching videos?

You've said it multiple times in this video, the world depends on tech but that should be a bad thing. Hundreds of years ago, humans were more social and didn't sit on a computer and send emails, they sent envelopes and communicated via person to person.
I may just be a "kid" and not know anything I'm talking about, but I would like to see how the world reacted to an event like this, without turning things back on. Yea, COVID ruined everything, and tech saved it, but not long ago. Hurricane Sandy shut down schools and they sat home doing nothing. If you're a kid, this is probably heaven, and if you're an adult, probably a little annoying., back then, you were probably neither.
-
All, I'm saying is I want to see how we would do without tech, and how we would react. The world is too dependant and that's kinda bad. Just think about it for a minute, or go watch another vid, It's all just an opinion.

6:25...12% per decade does not equate to 50% chance over the next fifty years. The probability is based upon an event over each solar cycle. (This is like saying the odds of heads is 50% in one flip and 100% in two flips...which is grossly incorrect.) This is because each solar cycle is not a duplicate event. Each has variable activity, length, different maxima and minima, etc. It is also important to understand that solar weather prediction, while getting better, is still woefully inaccurate and poorly understood.

The cost isn't estimated at 2.6 trillion all together....that is just the immediate cost of replacing damaged infrastructure (which is woefully too low)...if it could be replaced because inventory does not included a complete replacement of everything including rebuilding the capacity to build new parts.

If covid19 taught us anything, then the global cost will far exceed 25 trillion and the death toll will be catastrophic.

Given current events, you probably should have led with that...because an event of this magnitude would leave present society in ruins...with the exception of third world nations whose reliance on technology is far less a part of everyday life.

Minor note about the animation at 6:19: Assuming the correctness of the 12%, the mentioned 50/50 chance after 50 years is somewhat correct (52%), the numbers in the animation however are not. It shows 24% after 20 years (2x12), 48% after 40 (4x12). Following that animation it would mean that after 80 years there would be a 100% chance, but that's not accurate at all. Even after 100 years it would be at 72%, after 200 years it would be at 92%.

Correct formula to calculate that it happens (at least once) should be: 1-(1-0.12)^n, where n is the number of decades.

It's been a while since I've done such calculations, so feel free to correct me, but I actually feel fairly confident about this one.

So I stopped at a Jack in the Box on the way here, and the girl behind the counter said, “Hiya! Are you having an awesome day?” Not, “How are you doing today?” No. “Are you having an awesome day?” Which is pretty… shitty, because it puts the onus on me to disagree with her, like if I’m not having an “awesome day,” suddenly I’m the negative one.
Usually when people ask how I’m doing, the real answer is I’m doing shitty, but I can’t say I’m doing shitty because I don’t even have a good reason to be doing shitty. So if I say, “I’m doing shitty,” then they say, “Why? What’s wrong?” And I have to be like, “I don’t know, all of it?” So instead, when people ask how I’m doing, I usually say, “I am doing so great.”
But when this girl at the Jack in the Box asked me if I was having an awesome day, I thought, “Well, today I’m actually allowed to feel shitty.” Today I have a good reason, so I said to her, “Well, my mom died,” and she immediately burst into tears. So now I have to comfort her, which is annoying, and meanwhile, there’s a line of people forming behind me who are all giving me these real judgy looks because I made the Jack in the Box girl cry. And she’s bawling, and she’s saying, “I’m sorry, I’m so sorry,” and I’m like, “It’s fine. It’s fine.” I mean, it’s not fine but, you know, it’s… fine. And I would like to order a Double Jack Meal, and I’ve kinda got somewhere to be, so maybe less with the crying and more with the frying, huh? [inhales] And the girl apologizes again and she offers me a free churro with my meal. And as I’m leaving, I think, “I just got a free churro because my mom died.” No one ever tells you that when your mom dies, you get a free churro.
[people murmuring]
[clears throat]
Anyway, I’m sorry, that’s not part of the… [clears throat] All right. Okay, here we go. Let’s do this. Here I am, BoJack Horseman, doing a eulogy, let’s go. Hey, piano man, can I get a, like an organ flourish? [organ plays] Nicely done. You know, I was a little worried I wouldn’t have the right accompaniment today. I guess it’s a good thing my mom was an organ donor! [rimshot plays] What happened to the organ? [horn ‘oogahs’] Okay, why just leave the comedy to the professionals? Okay? This is a funeral, sir, for my mother. Can you show a little respect? [trumpet whines] I’ll take it.
Beatrice Horseman, who was she? What was her deal? Well, she was a horse. Uh, she was born in 1938. She died in 2018. One time, she went to a parade, and one time, she smoked an entire cigarette in one long inhale. I watched her do it. Truly a remarkable woman.
[rustling]
Lived a full life, that lady. Just, all the way to the end, which is, uh, now I guess. Really makes you think, though, huh? Life, right? Goes by, stuff happens. Then you die. Okay, well that’s my time, you’ve been great! Tip your waitress! No, I’m just kidding around, there’s no waitress. But seriously, that’s all I have to say about my mother. No point beating a dead horse, right? So…
[inhales] Now what? I don’t know. Mom, you got any ideas? Anything? Mom? No? Nothing to contribute? Knock once if you’re proud of me.
Can I just say how amazing it is to be in a room with my mother, and I can just talk and talk without her telling me to shut up and make her a drink? Hey, Mom, knock once if you think I should shut up. No? You sure? I mean, I don’t want to embarrass you by making this eulogy into a me-logy, so, seriously, if you wanted me to sit down and let someone else talk, just knock. I will not be offended. No? Your funeral.
Sorry about the closed casket, by the way. She wanted an open casket, but uh, you know, she’s dead now, so who cares what she wanted? No, that sounds bad. I’m sorry. I-I think that if she could’ve seen what she looked like dead, she’d agree it’s better this way. She looked like this.
